com.goinstant.auth

Class Signer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.goinstant.auth.Signer

  • public class Signer
extends Object
    Generates JWT Tokens for your Users. Produces tokens that not only log-in your users to GoInstant, but provides your GoInstant client-side application with valuable information about those users!
    Please read GoInstant guide on Security and Auth.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Signer(String secretKey)
      Creates a Signer with a base64 or base64url encoded secret key.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Parse a Base64 or Base64Url key into a byte array.
      String sign(User user)
      Create a signed JWT token for your GoInstant App.

      Create a signed JWT token for your GoInstant App, with custom headers.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Signer

        public Signer(String secretKey)
        Creates a Signer with a base64 or base64url encoded secret key. A single Signer can be re-used to sign additional tokens.
        Parameters:
        secretKey - your GoInstant application secret key
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the base64 is invalid or too short

    • Method Detail

      • parseKey

        public static byte[] parseKey(String key)
        Parse a Base64 or Base64Url key into a byte array.
        Parameters:
        key - base64 or base64url formatted key
        Returns:
        decoded bytes

      • sign

        public String sign(User user)
        Create a signed JWT token for your GoInstant App.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to create a token for. See PlainUser if you don't want to implement your own.
        Returns:
        signed token if successful, null otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the user or extraHeaders contain bad values or reserved custom properties.

      • sign

        public String sign(User user,
          Map<String,Object> extraHeaders)
        Create a signed JWT token for your GoInstant App, with custom headers.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to create a token for. See PlainUser if you don't want to implement your own.
        extraHeaders - a map of additional properties to include in the JWS header.
        Returns:
        signed token if successful, null otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the user or extraHeaders contain bad values or reserved custom properties.
        ClassCastException - if one of the extra headers' value is of the wrong type for that key.
